Dating: PSAMMETICHUS I/WAHIBRE (not before); 26TH DYNASTY; AMASIS/KHENEMIBRE (not after)
Name: Coffin of Pa-di-pep
Description: Anthropoid coffin of Pa-di-pep, a beautiful example of the perfection of stoneworking in the Late Period. The mummiform lid has a round face with striated beard, framed by a mighty wig and an ornate collar. The hieroglyphic inscription consists of a type of spell to glorify the deceased.
